page.title: 05Stowmarket:Rail Links
page.content: The geographical position of Stowmarket helps to explain the limited railway links with the rest of the country.With few exceptions Southbound trains go to Ipswich,Harwich or London and Northbound trains to Norwich,Cambridge or Peterborough.It is necessary to change trains to complete more complex journeys.However the Boat train in the early morning which starts from Harwich enables a passenger setting out from Stowmarket to reach Glasgow ten hours later with only one change of train. Trains to London and Norwich leave once every two hours but more frequently at peak times.There are 10 Cambridge trains in a day.The cheapest monthly rate costs 10 pounds for a London return.
